item.title: Using R and Vim together
item.description: Turn Vim into an R IDE Since a while i use vim and R together and i am very happy with that solution. In this post i just want tell how it works. What is an IDE IDE is the abbreviation for “integrated development environment”. Simply spoken it is a working environment to solve coding tasks. A full explanation gives for example Wikipedia. Why i do not use R Studio? Hmmm, well i started to use vim and have gotten used to it.

item.title: Creating a contact info QR code with LaTeX
item.description: QR Codes QR Codes are two dimensional “Quick Response Codes” presented first in the year 1994 by a japanese company. Nowadays QR Codes are widely used and a very effective way to transport short informations. LaTeX offers a package called pst-barcode which can be used to generate several different barcodes. Here i tried to create a Vcard. Unfortunately the Vcard convention is somewhat strange in the behaviour. So sometimes android phones stick with that generated qr code.

item.title: Serial documents with LaTeX
item.description: Serial Documents Often i have a task were i have to send documents or letters with an equal layout but different informations on it. The most prominient task surely are serial letters. To solve this task i use either MS Word or preferably LaTeX. The latter impresses with its excellent typesetting system. What you need data source LaTeX template The data source often comes as a plain formatted csv file.

item.title: Interpretation of statistical models by using DALEX
item.description: Intro In this post i follow a description on how to use the DALEX package that can help on model interpretation. The full example can be found in the MLR3 book here. The authors used the FIFA20 dataset to train a random forest model that predicts the soccer player worth. Subsequently they show how to use DALEX to analyze the model behaviour on a global level and of a single prediction.

item.title: Change Point Detection
item.description: Könnte interessant sein.. In diesem Beitrag zeige ich ganz kurz und knapp wie Segmente innerhalb einer Verlaufskurve detektiert werden können. Verlaufskurven kommen im Sport ja recht häufig vor. Am Beispiel meiner Laufdaten, die von einer Smart Watch aufgezeichnet wurden, zeige ich eine mögliche Vorgehensweise mit R. Eine schöne Übersicht über die verschiedenen Vorgehensweisen bietet Saskia Otto auf ihrer Homepage. Etwas ausführlicher beschäftigen sich Burg & Williams (2020) mit den verschiedenen Ansätzen.
